docs.snippet: MEETING in a distant capital and at a time when every country is preoccupied with domestic affairs, the seventh Pan-American Conference, now drawing to a close at Montevideo, has received comparatively little attention.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEETING in a distant capital and at a time when every country is preoccupied with domestic affairs, the seventh Pan-American Conference, now drawing to a close at Montevideo, has received comparatively little attention.

headline.main: CLOSER LINKS ARE FORGED BETWEEN THE TWO AMERICAS; Out of Montevideo Have Emerge'd Stronger Peace Machinery, A Move to Lower Tariff Bars and a New Amity Toward Us

byline.original: By RAYMOND LESLIE BUELL, President of the Foreign Policy Association

docs.snippet: The machinery set up to coordinate the work of aiding refugees from Germany to find a new place in the world was discussed in detail by James G. MacDonald, high commissioner for refugees coming from Germany, in a statement prepared at the request of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The machinery set up to coordinate the work of aiding refugees from Germany to find a new place in the world was discussed in detail by James G. MacDonald, high commissioner for refugees coming from Germany, in a statement prepared at the request of THE NEW YORK TIMES and issued shortly after his arrival last night on the United States liner Manhattan.
docs.abstract: J G McDonald returns to U S; puts number of refugees at 60,000; outlines plans; text

headline.main: J.G. M'DONALD PUTS EXILES AT 60,000; League Commissioner for the Reich Refugees Says Here Their Number Is Growing. TELLS NEED FOR FUNDS Appeals for Cooperation in Task of Finding Homes for Jews Ousted by Nazis.

docs.snippet: Jose Richling, Charge d'Affaires of the Uruguayan Government at Washington, announced here yesterday that he had received cabled advices from the Minister of Finance saying that the government had decided that its foreign debt should receive payment...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jose Richling, Charge d'Affaires of the Uruguayan Government at Washington, announced here yesterday that he had received cabled advices from the Minister of Finance saying that the government had decided that its foreign debt should receive payment of interest for 1934 at a rate not lower than 3 1/2 per cent.
docs.abstract: Fixes interest on foreign debt for 1934 at not less than 3 1/2%

headline.main: Uruguay Fixes Interest on Foreign Debt For 1934 at Not Less Than 3 1/2 Per Cent

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 24. -- A last-minute attempt to eliminate the Inter-American Commission of Women failed today when the Pan-American Conference at its final working session laughed out of existence a project which the steering committee had adopted a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 24. -- A last-minute attempt to eliminate the Inter-American Commission of Women failed today when the Pan-American Conference at its final working session laughed out of existence a project which the steering committee had adopted a few minutes earlier, providing for the creation of a new women's committee to take over the work now being done by the commission.
docs.abstract: Presents motion at Pan Amer Conf com meeting for cooperating com of women

headline.main: CONFERENCE SAVES WOMEN'S BOARD; Final Working Session Rejects Plan to Abolish Inter-American Commission. PARLEY ENDS TOMORROW Hull to Leave Montevideo at Once -- Agenda Cleared by Side-tracking Disputed Proposals.

byline.original: From a Staff Correspondent.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 24. -- A completely new vista in boundary relations was opened up today when a plenary session of the Pan-American Conference adopted an Argentine proposal for a conference at Buenos Aires to settle the Chaco conflict by considering...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 24. -- A completely new vista in boundary relations was opened up today when a plenary session of the Pan-American Conference adopted an Argentine proposal for a conference at Buenos Aires to settle the Chaco conflict by considering the economic and geographic problems of Bolivia and Paraguay.
docs.abstract: Pan Amer Conf adopts Argentine proposal for conf at Buenos Aires to settle dispute by considering economic and geographic problems; river projects involved

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 -- Larger purchases of American merchandise by twenty-nine countries in the first nine months of 1933, compared with the corresponding period of last year, were shown in a survey made public today by the United States Chamber of Commerce.

headline.main: EXPORTS INCREASED TO 29 COUNTRIES; Survey for 9 Months Shows 14 of These Are in Western Hemisphere. 5 OTHERS TAKE OVER HALF They Are Britain, Canada, Germany, Japan, France With Total of $194,854,000.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 26. -- Instead of closing with the customary solemn ceremony of signing the treaties, conventions, declarations and resolutions agreed upon during its three weeks' deliberations, the seventh Pan-American Conference broke up in a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 26. -- Instead of closing with the customary solemn ceremony of signing the treaties, conventions, declarations and resolutions agreed upon during its three weeks' deliberations, the seventh Pan-American Conference broke up in a grand scramble to catch tonight's river boat for Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: Delegates nearly sign wrong treaty in rush to leave Montevideo

headline.main: PACTS ARE SIGNED AS VESSEL WAITS; Montevideo Delegates in a Scramble to Catch Night Boat for Buenos Aires. WOMEN PREVENT MIX-UP Warn Those About to Put Names on Treaties They Opposed -- Few Documents Ready.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES.By JOHN W. WHITE

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 27 -- Bloc politics, and particularly bloc economics, are about to invade Pan-Americanism again. Even as the delegates to the seventh Pan-American Conference were scattering on their homeward ways today, this correspondent...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 27 -- Bloc politics, and particularly bloc economics, are about to invade Pan-Americanism again. Even as the delegates to the seventh Pan-American Conference were scattering on their homeward ways today, this correspondent learned that a strong probability exists that the eleven Caribbean countries may meet in the very near future to map out a program for joint action at the forthcoming Pan-American Economic and Financial Conference at Santiago, Chile.

headline.main: CARIBBEAN ARRAY AGAINST US URGED; Delegates of Cuba, Haiti and Nicaragua Discuss It at Montevideo. SEEK BLOC OF 11 NATIONS Mexico and South America Are Criticized as Having Swung Toward Our Attitude.
